reviews.sentence: Beautiful Clean Comfortable property. Great conference hotel very clean friendly staff and excellent amenities. Everyone was willing to assist with any question or request. Has its own walkway over the Pacific Coast Hwy to the beach. Close walk to the pier but lots to do on site too.

Beautiful business meeting. Stayed here a few times for work. It is a really nice hotel with great service good food and a lovely set up. It is kind of sprawling but that is to be expected in a big resort hotel. Gorgeous views of the pacific and easy to walk off site to shops and restaurants. If you want to do any surfing or things like that you can arrange it right on site. A great resort.

Business conference venue. A lovely beach front resort with a conference center equals a win win. Hosted 350 guests for a leadership conference with a guest speaker in the grand ballroom on a Friday then stayed over night to enjoy my Saturday. The staff were always friendly and helpful. You can not beat the location and view of the Pacific Ocean. The food was well presented and fresh a good variety and yummy. I would recommend the Hyat Regency Huntington Beach Resort and Spa to my friends and family.

This hotel is simply amazing. We had a medical emergency yesterday and the staff who helped us were unbelievable. Not only did they take care of us during the event they also went out of their way to try to ensure we had a wonderful time following the event. We are truly thankful and hope to return one day soon to enjoy this wonderful place and all of its offerings.

Great resort. Stayed several days here for the antibody engineering meeting. Great venue for business conferences with nice food and setup. Although did not have the chance to spend a lot of time on the beach I can clearly see its beautiful ocean view everyday being there.

EXCELLENT RESORT. I had great experience to stay in this resort and definitely will recommend to family and friends. I was attending SFA conference and really enjoyed business meeting with great pleasure. Most probably my next visit will be a pleasure visit.

Great Huntington Beach resort. Beautiful grounds on a great location across the Pacific Coast Highway from the Pacific Ocean with a convenient bridge to the beach. Great place for a convention or for leisure with a couple cool bars and restaurants in Petes and the WaterTable. Also a 4 Uber ride to downtown very convenient access to Main St.

Gem of Huntington Beach. I attended a conference at the Hyat Regency. We checked in and had a fabulous room overlooking the pool 4362. The room was spacious and very comfortable. The complex is pretty large and easy to get around. The staff as very friendly and accommodating. The pool was very nice a little cold but after all it is the end of September. The hotel is very close to the main part of town and the pier.

Exceptional Experience. Of all the hotels I have stayed in the staff at Hyat Regency made this the most exceptional stay I have had. I have never seen a whole team of people who are truly empowered who look after the guest and who genuinely care. This was from Housekeeping to Food Beverage to Front Desk the shuttle driver the pool bar and moreEach person wanted to ensure I was happy and had what I needed. It all appeared effortless on their part. When any minor item arose multiple solutions were offered and then followed up upon. The grounds rooms pools and conference rooms were all well maintained and very comfortable. The property is very large spread out so be prepared for lots of walking. Bridge over the road to the beach is fabulous. The property feels like a true get away. My only complaint would be the poor quality of wifi. Mine kept bouncing back to 3 G and I used up my 30 days allowance in 3 daysEnjoy.
Went to a business event here and the event space was very nice.

Disappointed Upon Check Out. Very Disappointed upon check out. I had an emergency business meeting that I was called out of town. after staying 3 nights at this hotel although I had reservations for 4 nights I tried to check out early in the am on the 4th night and was charged the full nights fare less a 750 early departure adjustment Big Deal. even after speaking with the meetings planner she was not understanding. This is why I prefer staying at Hilton properties as they are flexible to a business traveler as you can cancel prior to 40 pm the same day.

Beautiful location and amenities poor signage. Located on the east side of Pacific Coast Highway the Hyat Regency is in a spectacular location with a pedestrian bridge over PCH for easy access to the beach. The sprawling resort is appointed with fountains sculptures and quiet nooks with comfortable furniture around fireplaces. There are only a few elevators to guest floors and the maps outdoor signage and hall location indicators are very confusing. The map from check in was no help at all in finding the rooms. I wish when I arrived I used a bell hop because in a stay of two days I never found an easy route from the room to the conference location.

Suspected Valet. Had a meeting at the Hyat HB and used valet. First day I had glimpsed at the mileage before getting out. At end of day I was not certain but the numbers were different and higher. The next day I recorded the mileage and went on my way. When the car came back from valet there were an additional 2 miles and a residue on the wheel. For a garage directly underneath the hotel I had confirmation of my concern. The temptation to use any sedan for lunch a run on Beach Blvd apparently may be real and the supervision too low. So with the devil known moving on.

filthy bathroom tub. I was there for a conference which I was looking forward to attending. I was exhausted from a very busy day and just wanted to take a hot bath and get some rest but the bath tub was disgusting covered in a black oily tacky grime that leads me to believe that the rest of the room was not cleaned. The neighboring guests were VERY LOUD talkers into the wee hours of the morning and I barely got any sleep not to mention the feathers in their pillows poked me all night.

Massive and Beautiful. I was here for a conference so I had a standard room overlooking one of the pools and the power plant so not the best view. However the rooms are nice pretty standard and clean. I did appreciate the brighter lights in the bathroom I usually hate hotel bathroom lighting but this was well done. The property is absolutely beautiful with fountains palm trees and birds of paradise abounds. I found the staff to be very friendly and helpful and all the food we ate both via room service and the hotel restaurants were very good. This is a very big property so sometimes getting to your room is a haul. The bridge across the street to the beach makes getting over there a piece of cake. I would definitely stay at this hotel for pleasure given the chance but might upgrade myself to a room with a view next time.

Love this place. The property is beautiful and sprawling. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. My room was overlooking the spa courtyard. While is was quite a hike from the main area the view was worth it. All the staff were very pleasant and helpful. The conference facilities were better than most although the rooms were chilly. Not on the beach but there is a bridge that goes over PCH right to the beach.

Blah underwhelmed to be honest. Stayed here recently for a few days while attending meetings for work. I travel all over the country and have over the last few years had the privilege of staying at some of the finest hotels in North America. Looking up the Hyat online I had admittedly high expectations going in especially for the cost of the rooms etc. Located only about 20 minutes away from John Wayne airport it really was not hard to get here and only about 15 with an Uber. After arrival my check in was friendly enough however they had my arrival wrong and had me checking in a day later luckily I save everything and had the confirmation email from my company stating my arrival that day so they made the change but god forbid if I had not had that email how long would I have been standing at that desk trying to get a room. They gave me directions to my room and a map. I thought it was strange I was to be given a map to my room. until I found the room at the other end of the Hotel and after taking many wrong turns. For some reason my meetings were mainly centered at the reception lobby end of the hotel but someone had thought it was a good idea to put me almost at the very end room 2539 which meant that to go and eat attend my meeting or just grab a bite to eat or purchase something from the little village of stores they have it was a 10 minute walk. my commute to work is less than the time it took me to get from my room to my meetings. Also i was not impressed with the view from my room one side of the view was dominated by the wall of the corridor opposite and the rest of my view was looking over the roof of a pool area I had a hard time getting to. The view of Huntington Beach for me was mainly resigned to construction across the road and parts of the hotel building. On the plus side the food I experienced at the hotel was very good quality customer service was good even though they denied my request to move rooms and the one thing i was impressed at is somehow they have elevators down to a fine art. pretty much every time I pressed an elevator button it arrived within seconds such a small detail but important. Nice property friendly staff and great location but be aware of where they are putting you especially if getting around is a challenge for you or if indeed you have kids. However if you are intending to work on your cardio then this might be the situation for you.

MARQUE WEDDING. Stayed here for a wedding. Very nice hotel and wedding venue. The only thing wedding ballroom was quite a distance from the room we stayed at. Next time ill make sure to get one closer. But overall nice place.

The lounge areas and the outdoor areas are so beautiful. There was two weddings happening there when I went for a conference. One bad thing is the valet. They were not properly staffed when the wedding and conference ended. It was chaotic.

Great location and great food at convention center. Comfortable beds and staff was so pleasant and helpful. Watertable menu was very different so not our style but may appeal to others. Other than that the food at the grill polside Sunset Grill and convention center was good.

Work Conference. My husband joined me for a work conference at this resort. The location is spectacular and is within 20 minute walk to the pier and local restaurants. The resort grounds are gorgeous. The landscaping is picturesque. The pool area is magnificent. Lots of areas to relax outdoors from small or large groups. Really enjoyed the outdoor seating area with the fireplace. Very nice.

This place is gorgeous. We had a great pool view with the beach behind it. I did try to make some accommodations prior to my visit and that did not go as planned which was disappointing but I am not giving them less stars because of it. They had a few conferences going on and I am sure they were busy. The one complaint would be that the sheets are kind of noisy. I know that seems weird but they almost sounded like plastic. When there are two sleepers and one is a mover it got annoying.
